Wawrzon does not answer the "where" question but points to what he wants to play with . in Polish the preposition "with" is not used with inanimate objects .

Wawrzon uses both "ze" and "z" (with or from), the former used before words beginning with a consonant, the latter before words begining with a vowel or consonants that are easy to pronounce after the "z" sound . the correct form here is "z czego".
